name: Hard Songs Written About Real People Quiz / Test | Music | 10 Questions

questions.text: Easy Question to start you off: Bette Davis Eyes (Kim Carnes)
questions.explanation:
Bette Davis.

	Told you it was easy.

questions.text: I will always love you (Dolly Parton and Whitney Houston)?
questions.explanation:
Porter Waggoner.

	Yes, it was sung to Porter by Dolly when their partnership broke up, I just can't picture Whitney singing that song to Porter Waggoner.

Roseanna Arquette.

	One of the member of Toto was dating Roseanna Arquette at the time.

questions.text: The Greatest Love of All (Whitney Houston)?
questions.explanation:
Muhammad Ali.

	It's hard to believe but the song was written for the movie 'The Greatest' which was the story of Muhammad Ali. The original version was sung by George Benson.

John Lennon.

	It's about the death of John Lennon.

Marilyn Monroe.

	Goodbye Norma Jean who changed her name to Marilyn Monroe.

Julian Lennon.

	Written by Paul McCartney for Julian Lennon.

Billie Jean King.

	At the time the song was written, Billie Jean King was on a professional tennis team named 'Philadelphia Freedom'. Elton sure records a lot of songs about real people, doesn't he?

His Wife.

	Yes, it was written about his wife.

questions.text: Where did Lynyrd Skynyrd get their name?
options: From an Episode of 'The Twilight Zone'
They saw it on a billboard
questions.explanation:
Their Gym Teacher.

	The teacher's name was Leonard Skinner, so they changed that up a little to get their name.
